Description: Fragment of a silver finger-ring, comprising about 45 percent of the perimeter. The section of the metal is circular. Surface patinated.
Curator's comments: On the "many silver rings...found mostly on the surface, by the Bedawin", see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 75. Almost certainly part of the same ring as 1887, 0101.1424, and possibly part of the ring with bezel London, BM, EA 23852, represented unbroken in ibid. pl. xli, 32.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 75) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.67, p.68, p.69, p.182, pl.24)
